fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61220].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Email Filter Subscriptions are still sent after an user is marked as deactivated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA user.
# Log in as this user.
# Create a filter.
#* Filter used: issuekey in issueHistory() ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
#* Ticked the option to still send an email even there's no issue found.
# Subscribe to the filter.
# Deactivate the user.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA sends subscription notifications to active JIRA users.

h3. Actual Results
Deactivated users still receive email from the filter subscription. 

h3.Workaround
The documentation mentioned in JRA-23462 is not accessible. Will update if there is any updated workaround available.
fields.summary: Deactivated users still receive emails from filter subscriptions

fields.description:
The bug was introduced in one of the latest updates to jira-issue-nav-components in following modules:
jira/components/query/querystatemodel
jira/components/query/basic/searchermodel
jira/components/query/basic/searchercollection

By the following line:
"var displayFailSearchMessage = JIRA.Issues.displayFailSearchMessage;"

JIRA.Issues.displayFailSearchMessage is undefined during modules initialization, so displayFailSearchMessage becomes undefined and in case of the ajax error freezes the browser.
fields.summary: displayFailSearchMessage is undefined in com.atlassian.jira.jira-issue-nav-components:query

fields.description:
When using the JIRA desktop view on mobile and trying to edit an issue, the scrolling jumps back up once it reaches the bottom of the screen.

Steps to reproduce:
# Login to JIRA using an iPhone Safari browser
# switch from mobile view to the standard desktop
# Open an issue
# Select edit
# Scroll down to the end of the page to show comment section
# The scrolling jumps up, can never reach and stay at the bottom
fields.summary: JIRA desktop view on mobile scrolling is buggy for edit issue screen
need a JQL currentProject() function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61215].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When exporting an issue to any format, the exported file should contain all the columns specified in {{jira.table.cols.subtasks}} and not just the default fixed set of *Key, Summary, Type, Status* and *Assignee*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please implement a way to select which columns should be exported, or at least include them all.

h3. Workaround
Use the [Xporter for JIRA plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.xpandit.plugins.jiraxporter/server/overview]

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to *Cog Icon > System > Advanced Settings* and set the {{jira.table.cols.subtasks}} to the value {{issuetype, status, assignee, progress, duedate}}.
# Create a new issue of type *Task*.
# On the issue page, navigate to *More > Create Sub-Task*. Make sure to fill the field *Due Date* and create the new Sub-Task.
# Navigate to *Export > Word* or *Export > Printable*. Notice how the *Due Date* column is missing.
fields.summary: As a user I want the custom columns on subtasks to be exported with the issue so that I can have all the data I need

fields.description:
In previous versions of JIRA 6.4.x, the created vs resolved chart would be drawn to fill more of the resource space.  Since the upgrade of JIRA to version 7.x, it seems that at least this particular resource does not draw the graph as wide within the column layout selected.

 !jira64createvresolve.png|thumbnail! 

 !jira71createvresolve.png|thumbnail! 

Screenshots are from a 6.4.13 instance, and a 7.1.7 instance.  The 7.1.7 appears to be leaving a noticeable amount of more whitespace between the left/right edge of the graph and the edge of the resource box.  These screenshots are from a dashboard with a narrow left column and wider right column, however the same is true in different layouts.  Ideally the graph should be able to use more of the display area allotted to it, rather than using less.
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved chart in JIRA 7 does not graph the same width as previous versions

fields.description:
h3. *Issue Summary*
When a user is creating a new component in JIRA, if he accidentally types in a wrong user and presses add button, he would get the notification that he is attempting to add an invalid user.

Should the user correct himself at this point by typing in the username but not selecting it from the prompt and press add again, it would be expected that JIRA would update and give him the corrected user.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to a project component page.
# Add a name and start typing an incorrect name in the user picker field for component lead.
# Press the add button.
# JIRA would prompt you that you are adding an invalid user.
# Modify the component lead field and type in fully the username of a valid user and do not select the name when prompted by the drop down.
# Press add.

h3. *Actual Result*
Nothing happens and the invalid user error still appears. A refresh of the would show the component has been added though with the component lead field left empty.

h3. *Expected Result*
JIRA should update and reflect the changes when add is pressed.

h3. *New Observation*
_JIRA creates the component though the component lead failed on the first try_

h3. *Workaround*
# Refresh the page.
# Start typing the component lead's username and select it from the list prompted.
# Update the change.
fields.summary: User Picker Issue in Component page

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
If a Two Dimensional Filter finds _Irrelevant_ issues, the corresponding Total links become unclickable

h4. +Steps to Reproduce+
# Create 2 projects, each with a few versions
# Create a few issues in each project and assign an Affects Version/s to each of them
# Hide Affect Version/s from the Field Configuration of one of the projects
# Add a Two Dimensional Filter gadget to a dashboard
# Select Affect Version/s for X-axis and any other field for Y-axis

h4. +Expected Results+
All the Total links should be clickable

h4. +Actual Results+
Where there are _Irrelevant_ issues, the Total link is unclickable
!unclickable.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
* This may affect any other field - Affect Version/s is just an example
* The Total Unique Issues link is still clickable and will show all the issues including the _Irrelevant_ ones
fields.summary: Regression - Two Dimensional Filter - Totals not clickable if irrelevant issues are found.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Background Reindexing fail in *fixupConcurrentlyIndexedIssues* stage. This is done after all issue were reindexed and that stage JIRA reindexing issues modified during reindexing. Vast majority of the issue are reindexed. This doesn't lead to Lucene index corruption. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create large JIRA instance 
# Run background reindex 
# Modify issue (while reindex running)
# Delete same issue  (while reindex running)

h3. Expected Results
Background Reindexing will finish successfully. 

h3. Actual Results
Background Reindexing fail. 

The below exception is thrown in the log file.
 Timeline of the events:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-05-24 08:40:44,822 JiraTaskExectionThread-98 INFO admin 1260x7063070x2 fnv7xq 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] 2271483 issues reindexed in the background, in 301185598 millis.

2016-05-24 08:40:57,616 JiraTaskExectionThread-98 ERROR admin 1260x7063070x2 fnv7xq 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All In Background FAILED. Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/comments, /app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/issues, /app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/changes, /app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/worklogs]

2016-05-24 08:40:57,617 JiraTaskExectionThread-98 INFO admin 1260x7063070x2 fnv7xq 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [action.admin.index.IndexAdminImpl] Re-indexing finished

2016-05-24 08:40:57,617 JiraTaskExectionThread-98 ERROR admin 1260x7063070x2 fnv7xq 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl] Task 'JIRA Indexing' failed.
{code}

NullPointerException at {{fixupConcurrentlyIndexedIssues}} method:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-05-24 08:40:57,616 JiraTaskExectionThread-98 ERROR admin 1260x7063070x2 fnv7xq 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager] Reindex All In Background FAILED. Indexer: DefaultIndexManager: paths: [/app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/comments, /app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/issues, /app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/changes, /app_home/oracle/atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/worklogs]
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$3.consume(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:337)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer$3.consume(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:321)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.collect.CollectionUtil.foreach(CollectionUtil.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.util.IssueIdsIssueIterable.foreach(IssueIdsIssueIterable.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.perform(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:320)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueIndexer.reindexIssues(DefaultIssueIndexer.java:174)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.IssueIndexHelper.fixupConcurrentlyIndexedIssues(IssueIndexHelper.java:117)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doBackgroundReindex(DefaultIndexManager.java:1095)

None

h3.Workaround

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61186].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Latest dbconfig.xml for MySQL looks like below:

{code:java}
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>mysql</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/jiradb7010?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB</url>
    <driver-class>com.mysql.jdbc.Driver</driver-class>
    <username>root</username>
    <password>xxxxxxxxxx</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <validation-query>select 1</validation-query>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>60000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>300000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
    <pool-test-while-idle>true</pool-test-while-idle>
    <validation-query-timeout>3</validation-query-timeout>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}

While validation query is set here, there's no <pool-test-on-borrow> set to false line. This will cause Health Checker plugin to throw error below:

"The database configuration 'pool-test-on-borrow' is not set as per our recommended settings."

*Suggested Solution*

Add <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow> line in the dbconfig.xml when instance with MySQL database is created.

*Workaround*

Add the <pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow> line to the dbconfig.xml manually and restart JIRA to resolve the Health Checker error.
fields.summary: MySQL Pool Test Borrow error
Link to the export/import documentation on the Backup Manager and JIRA Import screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61183].
  {panel}

h4. PROBLEM:
One critical feature/functionality that is missing in JIRA is the ability to define a custom field based on a JQL. This is useful to seamlessly integrate different projects/processes within JIRA.

Example: A select-field (or auto-complete, etc.) that its values are based on the issues from Project X with Status Y (this is defined via a JQL).

h4. Workaround:
There are two primary plugins for this purpose. Each of these have certain deficiencies and are not reliable.
* Query Issues Custom Fields
* JQL Issue Select

h4. SUGESSTION:
It would be great if this feature becomes native in JIRA.
fields.summary: Custom Field Defined by JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61177].
  {panel}

I try to use JIRA Webhook on new and updated comments to show JIRA comments in Slack, using Zapier webhook.
After the webhook is connected, i can see in Zapier what are my optional parameters to use.
But the issue id doesn't show .

Any reason for that?
fields.summary: Webhook for new and updated comments doesn't give issue id

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61176].
  {panel}

While getting from the REST API route: /rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields
The response we received is a malformed JSON that appears to be truncated arbitrarily, always at the same position.

Due to privacy concerns, we're not able to provide an example of the output. However we'll explain how to replicate this problem.

h4. Preconditions
Use a JIRA instance hosted on atlassian.net

h4. Examples
h5. Not working calls
{quote}
curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Accept-Encoding: gzip" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" \
 --compressed

curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" \
 --compressed

curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" {quote}

All those calls will return an invalid JSON response as it is truncated.

h5. Working Calls
{quote}
curl -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Accept-Encoding: gzip
" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" \
 --compressed

curl -i -X "GET" "https://subdomain.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields" \
-H "Accept-Encoding: foo
" \
-H "Authorization: JWT /TOKEN/" {quote}

*Notice that the working calls have a line break in the content of the Accept-Encoding header. *

The token used comes from an Atlassian Connect application. An anonymous request (No authorization header) won't truncate the response.

This needs to be investigated. How can we help?
fields.summary: Createmeta API response truncated and malformed

fields.description:
*Description of Problem* 
The instructions for "Configuring a JNDI Location" are no longer correct and should be updated to include correct information.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Configuring+JIRA's+SMTP+mail+server+to+send+notifications#ConfiguringJIRA%27sSMTPmailservertosendnotifications-ConfiguringaJNDIlocation

The directions mention two JAR files mail-1.4.1.jar and activation-1.1.1.jar. The versions of these are different in JIRA 7. 
* In addition, there is no "mail-1.4.1.jar" of any version. The correct file is javax.mail-x.y.z.jar where x.y.z is the version. 

The directions do not include a third file that needs to be moved, javax.mail-api-x.y.z.jar. 

*Suggested Resolution* 
* Review current version and past versions of documentation and correct where necessary. 
** It appears this section of the documentation may have been copied from an older version.
fields.summary: Update Configuring a JNDI location documentation
JIRA Releases Date to be synced with Confluence date in specific page
It should be documented that JIRA Core Labs boars do not work if you have multiple workflow defined for the project
Add "copy from user property" post-function as JIRA default

fields.description:
In Jira 6.1.1 there is the posibility to show "All issues", "Unresolved", .... for one project directly to use the links see (projectIssues.png).

Is this feature also possible in Jira 7.1.1? There is in 7.1.1 at the left side 
menu also this links "All Issues", .... but this links always show "All Issues"
of all projects. 

There are no longer the direct links for projects?
This is not realy acceptable for the users.
fields.summary: Posibility to show "All issues", "Unresolved", .... for one project
Allow for LDAP syncing to be disabled prior to server start up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61167].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, a user with administrator permission with application access can only be used for running automated process like running a script to automate backup generation or download backup. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a functional only user that can be used for running a script to automate backup generation or download backup. One example is the functional user used for add-ons.
fields.summary: Provide a functional only user that can be used for running automated process

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Datacenter is unresponsive during deletion custom fields context.

{{ManageConfigurationScheme}} flushes cache data: *fields context*, *config scheme issue type* and *custom fields* across all cluster nodes for each modification. When we reload cache we load ALL RECORDS from {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype}} table. Then this data need to be loaded back into cache at each node, which is causing performance degradation. 
Most data structure operation are cluster wide, so executing them from the dark node unfortunatly will have same effect and will not help.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA DC
 * High load
 * Large number of
 ** Custom-Fields: 2000+
 ** Number of elements in {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype}}: 10000+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Custom-Field, for example by changing/deleting context.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA cluster peformance doesn't degrade significantly,
h3. Actual Results

JIRA Datacenter is unresponsive.
h3. Notes
 * Problem can be partially mitigated by improving cache loading for _fieldLayoutCache_, see workaround - JRASERVER-66013

h3. Workaround

Execute operation during low activity.
fields.summary: Performance of JIRA Datacenter degrades significantly after customfields configuration task
Amendment required to doco on Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the Oracle database is configured for NLS_SORT="GERMAN", but all JIRA sessions are changed to "BINARY" by a logon trigger, the database collation read still incorrectly reads the collation.
h3. Environment
 * Oracle
 * NLS_SORT of German
 * JIRA sessions changed to BINARY by a login trigger.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up expected environment.
 # Start JIRA.
h3. Expected Results

The collation is correctly read.
h3. Actual Results

The collation is read as incorrect and errors are thrown in the logs as per below:
{noformat}
2016-05-20 07:18:01,269 JIRA-Bootstrap WARN      [c.a.j.appconsistency.db.CollationCheck] 
    
    ****************************************************************************************************
    You are using an unsupported oracle10g collation: GERMAN. This may cause some functionality to not work.
    Please use BINARY as the collation instead.
    ****************************************************************************************************

{noformat}
h3. Notes

# This is a spurious error and can be ignored. If unsure, use the [Database Collation Health Check|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Health+Check%3A+Database+Collation] to verify the collation is correct (it will take into account the session collation as the collation is checked with different SQL).

# Starting with JIRA 7.4, a new functionality is introduced which is the Johnson page where a startup check is performed and JIRA is locked upon startup to return an error or warning. Due to the nature of this error, JIRA will be locked and the following warning will be shown during startup:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
It is safe to proceed with clicking on "Ignore all warnings and continue" in this scenario.
fields.summary: The database collation reader incorrectly reports collation for Oracle if there is a session collation used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61161].
  {panel}

h5.Current behaviour
# Go to Issue
# On the *History* tab

*Result:* History tab shows the recent changes for issue field

 !image-2016-05-25-10-27-58-112.png|thumbnail! 

h5.Requested change
Have *undo/revert/rollback* button on the history tab next to the original/old issue field content so that users are able to rollback content easily.

h5.Workaround
User manually refered the history tab and change according to the data inside tab.
fields.summary: Undo issue field using history

fields.description:
If we have an issue:

{code:sql}
select id, issuenum, reporter, creator, created
from jiraissue
where issuenum = 9984;
  id   | issuenum | reporter | creator  |        created
-------+----------+----------+----------+------------------------
 76171 |     9984 | jirarest | jirarest | 2016-05-09 08:00:57-05
{code}

and we have a change item for status field of that issue:
{code:sql}
select i.oldvalue,
	   i.oldstring,
	   i.newvalue,
	   i.newstring,
	   g.created
from changeitem i
left join changegroup g
on i.groupid = g.id
where field = 'status'
and g.issueid = 76171;
 oldvalue | oldstring | newvalue | newstring |        created
----------+-----------+----------+-----------+------------------------
 1        | Open      | 1        | Open      | 2016-05-09 08:00:58-05
{code}


Then change history index will contain item with date *2016-05-09 08:00:57-05* instead of date *2016-05-09 08:00:58-05*.
In that particular case it will contain two items - one with wrong date and one with proper date.

If I update data in that way:
{code:sql}
select i.oldvalue,
	   i.oldstring,
	   i.newvalue,
	   i.newstring,
	   g.created
from changeitem i
left join changegroup g
on i.groupid = g.id
where field = 'status'
and g.issueid = 76171;
 oldvalue | oldstring | newvalue | newstring |        created
----------+-----------+----------+-----------+------------------------
          |           | 1        | Open      | 2016-05-09 08:00:58-05
{code}

Then index will contain one item with date from issue instead of actual date of change.


I pretty sure that this bug affects a lot of versions but I tested only on 7.1.6 Server.
fields.summary: Change item for status field has wrong change time in index if this time differs from issue creation time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61158].
{panel}
h3. Summary

If a user shares a filter or dashboard with a group or project role, that user must be a member of the group or role being shared.

This check is also performed on existing entries on the share screen - therefore, if the user sharing the filter/dashboard is not a member of +all+ roles and groups selected for sharing, the share will fail.

In addition, for roles, the role name is obscured with "Unknown Role", making it hard for the user to correct the problem. 
h4. How to reproduce - Dashboard
 # On a sample project where you are Project Admin, add your own user to the project role "Developers"
 # Create a new dashboard, then visit ... in top right, and choose Share
 # Share to the project, role -> Developers, and click Update.
 # Remove the user from the role on that project
 # Share the dashboard again:
 ## Note: the project role now says "Unknown Role"
 ## Try to add another role to share, say, Project Role -> Administrators, and click Update. It will fail with:
{code:java}
You do not have permission to share with Project: 'SD' Role: [Unknown Role]. {code}

h4. How to reproduce - Filter
 # On a sample project where you are Project Admin, add your own user to the project role "Developers"
 # Save a new filter, then click Issues Menu -> Manage Filters
 # Find your filter in the list, then click the Cog icon, then Edit
 # Share to the project, role -> Developers, and click Save.
 # Remove the user from the role on that project
 # Share the Filter again:
 ## Note: the project role now says "Unknown Role"
 ## Try to add another role to share, say, Project Role -> Administrators, and click Update. It will fail with:
{code:java}
You do not have permission to share with Project: 'SD' Role: [Unknown Role]. {code}

h3. Expected Results

The user is still able to share the filter/dashboard
h3. Actual Results

The share is unable to be saved, showing one of the following errors:
{code:java}
You do not have permission to share with Group: 'example-group'.
{code}
{code:java}
You do not have permission to share with Project: 'ExampleProject' Role: [Unknown Role].
{code}
This appears in the browser’s JavaScript Console:
{noformat}
batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&is-system-admin=true…:3875 PUT https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/filter/10100?expand=subscriptions[-5:] 400 ()
{noformat}
Analysing HAR files will give you this:

!Screen Shot 2019-01-28 at 12.08.19.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

There’s a similar problem here:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59185
h3. Workaround
h4. Workaround 1

Delete all share permissions on groups/roles that you are not a direct member of.
 # Find the filter or dashboard, and enter the share screen:
 ## +For Filters+: Click Issues Menu -> Manage Filters. Under _My Filters_ click the Filter, then click ‘cog icon’ >> ‘Edit’
 ## +For Dashboards+, Visit the dashboard, then choose [ ... ] -> Share Dashboard
 # Click the 'trash can' icon next to each group or role that you are not a member of
 ## (i) Roles needing to be removed will be displayed as "unknown role", however, groups will not show any indication.
 # Click Update
 ## (i) If an error is still shown, there are still additional group/role shares that will need to be 'trash can'ed

h4. Workaround 2

Add the user back to the group/role. (this may cause changes in permission for this user, make sure to check this first).
fields.summary: Cannot save filter or dashboard if user is not part of group shared in filter/dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61157].
  {panel}

Currently, the JIRA Core Server Documentation on [Linking issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER071/Linking+issues#Linkingissues-CreatingalinktoaConfluencepage], makes no reference to the following:
- How to navigate to the Issue linking page
- How to edit, delete, or create a new issue link type

Looking at our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/configuring-issue-linking-683542594.html] pre JIRA 7 this information was documented before:
{quote}Adding a link type
To create a new link type, e.g. 'Causes':
Log in as a user with the JIRA Administrators global permission.
Choose  > System. Select Issue Features > Issue Linking to open the Issue Linking page.
(tick) Keyboard shortcut: g + g + start typing issue linking
In the 'Add New Link Type' form at the end of the page:
Enter 'Causes' in the Name text field.
Enter 'causes' in the Outward Link Description text field.
Enter 'is caused by' in the Inward Link Description text field.
Click the Add button.
This returns to the Issue Linking page, with a new section listing the Causes link type.
{quote}

Our current documentation should be updated to include details on how to navigate to the Issue linking page as well as how to create a new issue link type.
fields.summary: Update Linking issues documentation to include issue link type details

fields.description:
I get an error when I start typing a name while editing contributors for some Apache project using JIRA. The list of contributors is very large, which is probably causing this effect. I can edit other role lists on the same page, so I'm assuming it's not a permission issue.
I get this on Firefox (the headers provided) and Chrome 50.0.2661.

The fix aside, I wonder if there's a workaround for this; the error dialogs can be silenced via the checkbox in both browsers; if I could just type usernames in the usual format with tilde or an @ that would work for me, but if I do that and hit update, the user is not added.

Request and response headers from the background calls made by the control; these happen every time one types something and result in the error dialog.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61140].
  {panel}

In JIRA 7.1.x you are unable to perform a search against the assignee field using the WAS operator and full name e.g. assignee WAS "Homer Simpson".  

Customers report that as of JIRA 6.4.12 you could perform a search similar to project = PRJ AND assignee was "Homer Simpson" and the documentation included an example of this:  https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/advanced-searching-683542528.html#AdvancedSearching-WAS

The [7.1 Advanced searching - operators reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver071/advanced-searching-operators-reference-800707158.html#Advancedsearching-operatorsreference-WASWAS] does not include references to using the full name. 

The [Advanced searching - fields reference for 7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Advanced+searching+-+fields+reference] states you can perform a search against the assignee field using WAS and provides an example

If the intended functionality is not to allow the WAS operator to search by full name in the assignee field can we make the documentation consistent.  If not, please advise.

Thanks,

Branden
fields.summary: Conflicting documentation regarding searching assignee by Full Name using WAS operator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61134].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian!

I am the developer of the Table Grid Editor add-on (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.idalko.jira.plugins.igrid/server/overview).
I am using custom field default value as a storage for a grid configuration. It can be quite large depending on the number of columns in the grid. Some customers report that they are getting error on saving of the custom field default value on the JIRA instances which use Oracle database. I checked it and noticed, that XMLVALUE column of the GENERICCONFIGURATION table that is used for this purpose has extremely short length(4000) whereas in other databases there is no limit at all on this column.

As the result some of our customers experience inconvenience working with Table Grid Editor on Oracle. Can you expand the length of the column or remove the limit at all in future versions?
fields.summary: Increase the length of the XMLVALUE column in GENERICCONFIGURATION table

h4. Problem
The  [Migrating JIRA applications to another server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Migrating+JIRA+applications+to+another+server] article does not explicitly mention porting over the SSL keystore. If the keystore is not migrated to the new server/installation folder, the application and service integrations that use SSL will break.

h4. Suggestion
Please mention that the [truststore|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/connecting-to-ssl-services-117455.html] has to be migrated/merged over to the new installation, to avoid problems during/after server migration.
fields.summary: Documentation request: Keystore migration to new installation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61128].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence search from JIRA Issue, which uses deprecated _confluence2.search_ of _xml-rpc_, does not work with some double-byte characters. REST API should be used instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 5.9.11 and JIRA Core 7.1.7 (latest), and applink them
# On Confluence, enable Remote API
# On Confluence, change indexing language to "CJK"
# On Confluence, create a space and create these 2 pages:
-- Title: Title-1 Body: ボディ (FYI, it is 'body' in Japanese)
-- Title: Title-2 Body: ボディ (FYI, it is 'body' in Japanese)
# On JIRA, create a project and a issue
# On JIRA's Issue detail view, go to "More" -> "Link" -> "Confluence Page" -> "search for a page", and search Confluence pages by keyword "ボディ"
# No search results, although you get the results if you use the same search keyword on Confluence (i.e. <CONF_BASE_URL>/dosearchsite.action?queryString=ボディ)

See also attached "theProblem.jpg"
(!) This also impacts searching Jira Issues to Link issues.

h3. Expected Results
It should show the 2 pages created in the above step

h3. Actual Results
No search results.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2015-07-29 17:06:44,519 ERROR [http-nio-15806-exec-8] [confluence.rpc.auth.TokenAuthenticationInvocationHandler] invokeAuthenticatedMethod Error during invocation of method [search]
 -- url: /confluence15806/rpc/xmlrpc | userName: admin | method: search
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1955)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.search.summary.Summarizer.getSummary(Summarizer.java:164)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.GeneralUtil.makeSummary(GeneralUtil.java:1733)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.GeneralUtil.makeFlatSummary(GeneralUtil.java:1769)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.beans.RemoteSearchResult.<init>(RemoteSearchResult.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.services.PagesSoapService.search(PagesSoapService.java:431)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.soap.XhtmlSoapService.search(XhtmlSoapService.java:535)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor848.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:16)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy1329.search(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.xmlrpc.ConfluenceXmlRpcHandlerImpl.search(ConfluenceXmlRpcHandlerImpl.java:485)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor847.invoke(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
I raised it as a bug instead of suggestion, because I firstly created a bug ticket for Confluence (CONF-38631), however, it was closed because JIRA uses _xml-rpc_, which was deprecated since Confluence 5.5.

h3.Workaround
No workaround is found so far
fields.summary: JIRA should use REST API to search Confluence pages and Link Jira Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61127].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 
Subscriptions work off of the server time, instead of my local user time. If these two timezones are different, the user must manually calculate the right times for the system to use. 
Additionally, time ranges cannot be specified "backwards" - I cannot specify hourly notifications from starting at 10pm and finishing at 7am. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.1.2

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a filter
# Select Issues in the header, then Manage Filters
# Click 'Subscribe'

h3. Expected Results
Dialog uses local user time

h3. Actual Results
Dialog indicates that it uses server time

h3. Notes
The text indicating the server time is not very obvious, so this discrepancy may not even be noticed by users. 

h3. Workaround
Users can manually convert the times required. 
Users can add multiple subscription filters (say, 10pm - 11pm, and a second filter 12am - 7am).
fields.summary: Subscriptions use server time instead of local time
Ability to edit consumer callback URL in Application Links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61122].
{panel}
h5. PROBLEM:

In some cases, not all project admins should have access to all JIRA Administrator or JIRA System Administrators permission. But unfortunately, with the current configuration, the group of permission is bundled together with JIRA Administrator / JIRA System Administrator global permission which allows user who are grouped under JIRA Administrator / JIRA System Administrator to have access to all the permissions.
h5. SUGGESTION:

It would be awesome if JIRA will have standalone permissions, separating it from JIRA Administrators / JIRA System Administrator global permission. Eg: Provide an option to assign a user or user group with "Managing User" permission only. In this way, we will have more flexibility when it comes to delegating permissions to each admins.
fields.summary: Separate "Create User" permission under Global Permissions

Apache Maven 3.3.9 (bb52d8502b132ec0a5a3f4c09453c07478323dc5; 2015-11-10T08:41:47-08:00)
Maven home: E:\Java\apache-maven-3.3.9\bin\..

Java home: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_79\jre
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: Cp1252
OS name: "windows 7", version: "6.1", arch: "amd64", family: "windows"

It would be nice if tickets had fields for each component in the above.

Maybe when I admin/create a new JIRA project, I can pick whether to include "Maven version fields" which will be auto filled when I paste the above in the Environment text box.

2c,
Gary
fields.summary: Parse the output of 'mvn -version' and auto-fill in various fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61120].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The email prefix in the outgoing SMTP is a global setting, this prevents this from being a useful field as we may want a prefix on a SD project that is different from a JSW project

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow an email prefix to be set per project
fields.summary: Custom email prefix per project
Allow linking to the Project's versions in the comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61118].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to import external web links from CSV

\\
h3. Suggested Solution
It should be possible to upload a link via an Excel CSV into issue links (or maybe into a new field named "external links") providing the below 3 elements:
1. URL.
2. Link text.
3. Comment
fields.summary: Possibility to import external web-links from CSV into issue links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61117].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When viewing search results in a Service Desk, the results window only takes up a smaller portion of the entire browser window. It would be helpful if this took up more space within the browser window.


h3. Environment
Cloud




h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Service Desk that has searchable content
# Search for any article
# Click on the article link


h3. Expected Results

Results window should take up the entire window / portal


h3. Actual Results

Results window only takes up a small portion of the entire window / portal
fields.summary: Result window in Service Desk does not span entire screen

fields.description:
Trying to view a thumbnail of a deleted attachment, we get HTTP-status 404 (correctly). However, the mime/type of the response is incorrectly set to {{image/png}}, which prevents the browser from showing the error-page properly -- it tries to render the HTML as PNG... Here are the headers from one such request:
{code}
GET /secure/thumbnail/51273/_thumb_51273.png HTTP/1.1
....
HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-AREQUESTID: 581x3167036x1
X-ASESSIONID: k5hwsp
X-ASEN: SEN-419716
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK
X-AUSERNAME: mtXXX
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
Content-Type: image/png;charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2325
Date: Fri, 20 May 2016 13:41:16 GMT
{code}
Also, looking inside the HTML-text, I see that it is generic: "Oops, you've found a dead link. - JIRA". Instead it should, probably, say something more specific. For example: "Attachment _foo_ has been deleted and its thumbnail is no longer available." But that's a minor point...
fields.summary: When issuing a 404 for a deleted attachment thumbnail, Content-Type is set to image/png instead of text/html

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61114].
  {panel}

*Problem*
JIRA currently uses the base url to retrieve gadgets which has recently been causing alot of broken gadgets due to this issue :
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget

*Suggestion*
* Allow JIRA to communicate to itself using a localhost
* Allow JIRA to call the gadgets using a 2nd base URL which can be configured to be localhost
* Allow JIRA to be configuted with Multiple Baseurl
fields.summary: Provide ability for Jira gadget specifications to be retrieved using localhost url or more than one base url

fields.description:
After chosing a date in date picker, it writes the date in the field in an invalid format:
"dd MM-yy-HH:mm" instead of "dd/MM/yy HH:mm"

 !image-2016-05-20-14-35-44-921.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Date picker in "create an issue" pannel sets invalid date format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61111].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to mention customers.

In a normal setting, the 'mentions' functions allows JIRA users to mention and pull an issue to the attention of another user not involved in the ticket. However, in the case of Agents, this functionality is useful where they have thousands of users all over the globe, it would not be easy or efficient to copy exact spelling of the customers names.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the agents to mention customers to bring easy and efficiency to agents dealing with customers without worrying about the exact spelling. This mentions, unlike in JIRA, will not send an email notification, but would rather just assist the agent in working more efficiently.
fields.summary: As an Agent, I want to be able to 'mention' users rather than having to copy down the exact spelling of the name

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
Importing a workflow *.jwb file is not possible. I followed the instructions given on "[Importing from local instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/sharing-your-workflow-776636610.html]". Everything works fine until I reach the last step of mapping workflow statuses (/plugins/servlet/wfshare-import/map-statuses). Once clicked on the "Next" button, a blank page appears.

This has been seen on Chrome, Firefox & IE.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Navigate to _JIRA Administration > Issues > Workflows_
# Expand the Inactive Workflow and Export *jira* workflow as JWB. ( _View > Export > as Workflow_ )
# Now, back to Workflow page and Click "Import" then select "Import Workflow"
# Change the tab to "From Computer" and select the exported *jira* workflow.
# Follow the wizard.
(i) This can also be reproduced by importing a workflow from Marketplace.

h3. Expected Results:
* The Wizard will guide the user through the Import and the workflow is created in the instance.

h3. Actual Results:
* The Wizard will stop and give out a Blank Page after clicking "Next" at Mapping Workflow Status step.

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
This ticket derives from JRA-59872, in which the sorting is fixed for JIRA Administration -> Issues -> Issue Types page.

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
h5. 1. Issue Creation dialog
# click Create to create a new issue
# select a project which uses Default Issue Type Scheme (or any scheme that uses multiple issue types)
# click the Issue Type field
-> (x) the list of issue types appears not sorted

h5. 2. Field Context definition
# go to Custom Fields page
# Configure a field and Edit Configuration for a context
-> (x) at 'Choose applicable issue types', the list of issue types appears not sorted

h5. 3. Add/Modify Issue Type Scheme
# go to Issue type schemes page
# Either click “Add Issue Type Scheme” or “Edit” for an existing scheme
-> (x) at ‘Available Issue Types’, the list of issue types appears not sorted
fields.summary: Issue Types are not sorted alphabetically in various screens
Work Log on view issue screen is showing wrong time stamp

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61103].
  {panel}

Confusing our developers: The time tracking widget when viewing an issue shows a bar graph for Estimated time being *4 hours* and the remaining being 2 hours, but the time tracking view in the issue details view to the right of the backlog shows *2 hours* estimated and 2 hours for remaining. At the very least, this should be consistent. 

The parameters that lead to this are:
# Sub tasks with time listed for estimate and remaining.
# Include sub-tasks box checked in time-tracking widget the main issue viewing page. 
# Task times set <manually to sum of all sub-tasks> for estimated and 0 for remaining. 

The inconsistency is a bug and should be resolved. However, there is a much bigger usability problem here between sub-tasks and time tracking that should be resolved. See your own support forum for example: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/28328/jira-and-sub-tasks
and https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/84349/rapid-board-time-estimates-with-sub-tasks

The sub-tasks (when include sub-task time is checked) should be included in BOTH the estimate and the remaining. This has been an ongoing issue for many users at EVERY company I have worked for that uses JIRA. For, what should really not be a complicated fix, why is there not at least an option for this?
fields.summary: Time tracking for sub-tasks is inconsistent between views. As well as not intuitive.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61102].
  {panel}

User has created a dashboard that they share with other users. When they view the dashboard from their users, since they do not own the dashboard, the ability to edit the dashboard is disabled. This includes changing colors, edit, delete and dragging the dashboards to a new location.

They would like the ability to lock a dashboard from editing until they choose to unlock it so that their daily use of the dashboard is the same as the users that I share it with.
Periodically when minimizing a dashboard, it ends up dragging it instead of minimizing or maximizing. This is not a problem that other users have, because of permissions settings.
It was suggested giving control of the dashboard to another user, but then editing requires logging out and logging back in as a separate user in order to manage the dashboards.
The request is to add an option in the Tools menu to "Lock Dashboard" and then while it is locked have the "Un-Lock Dashboard" action. The Lock action causes the dashboard to draw as though the user was not the owner and restricts all edit permissions. And then when the Un-Lock action is performed, the dashboard reverts to the current behavior.
fields.summary: Enable ability to lock edit of dashboards from owner.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to perform a External System Import, the UI will prompt the user that there's a newer version of the plugin (JIM) available. 

However, if the user clicks on "Download it now!", he is taken to the UPM with no option to update the JIM plugin from there.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh instance of JIRA 7.1.6
# Go to External System Import
# The UI will display the message that there is a newer version available. 
# Click on the "Download it now!" link 

h3. Expected Results
The user can then see that the jira-importers-plugin has a newer version available and can update it through the UI.

h3. Actual Results
The is no option to update the jira-importers-plugin through the UI.

h3. Notes
At the time of this writing, JIRA comes bundled with the JIM plugin at version 7.1.6 and the latest version of JIM is 7.1.8
JIRA 7.2.1 comes with bundled JIM plugin at version 7.1.25 and there is no newer version in Marketplace.

h3.Workaround
# Download the latest version of the JIRA Importers Plugin through the Atlassian Marketplace [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin/versions].
# Install the plugin by [file upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload].
fields.summary: Cannot update jira-importers-plugin (JIM) to the latest version through the UPM

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JIRA Lucene index is based on the data in DB, effectively it's a search index. Any problems with Lucene index will cause problem with search results, JIRA Dashboards, or JIRA Software Dashboards. Lucene Index might get corrupted under high load and ungraceful shutdown or crash of JIRA/JVM. 

h3. Expected Results
It recovers from transaction log or nearest checkpoint. 

h3. Actual Results
Lucene data is corrupted and JIRA doesn't function properly. 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-05-17 04:48:49,064 http-bio-8080-exec-16 ERROR admin288x38453x8 1k54nbw 127.0.0.1 /browse/PP [jira.projects.web.BrowseProject] Tab panel 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:summary-panel' failed to render.
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException: com.atlassian.jira.util.RuntimeIOException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /atlassian/application-data/jira/caches/indexes/issues/_nfbu.cfs (No such file or directory)
{code}

h3. Notes
h5. Plugins continue to operate After consistencyChecker is Run
* IndexWriters are being shutdown and closed in {{consistencyChecker.destroy(ServletContextProvider.getServletContext())}}.
* The problem is that we stop plugins after it. So SD Automation is still running and it creates a new IssueIndexer.
* This also explains, why we see the following in the end of the log file:
{noformat}
12-Jun-2017 15:03:42.169 WARNING [localhost-startStop-2] org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.clearReferencesThreads The web application [ROOT] appears to have started a thread named [ISSUE-indexQueue:thread-1] but has failed to stop it. This is very likely to create a memory leak. Stack trace of thread:
 sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
 java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
 java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442)
 com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.index(QueueingIndex.java:142)
 com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.run(QueueingIndex.java:111)
 java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

The second instance of IssueIndexer thread isn't stopped by anybody. So, it
* Is still running in the end of shutdown;
* Doesn't flush the changes to index file.

h5. Force Kill via stop-jira.sh
# By default {{bin/stop-jira.sh}} script forces JIRA shutdown after 20 seconds:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
exec $PRGDIR/shutdown.sh 20 -force $@
{code}
from {{bin/catalina.sh}} 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
  if [ $FORCE -eq 1 ]; then
  ..
      if [ -f "$CATALINA_PID" ]; then
        PID=`cat "$CATALINA_PID"`
        echo "Killing Tomcat with the PID: $PID"
        kill -9 $PID
{code}
# JIRA uses Lucene 3.3.0. 
# Due to inefficiency in JIRA 6 plugin system, shutting down JIRA instance could take up to 10 minutes.
# Segments File description http://lucene.apache.org/core/3_3_0/fileformats.html#Segments%20File
# Possibly caused by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-3418 


h3.Workaround
* Enable Index Recovery, please see [Backing up and recovering your index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/search-indexing-720412021.html#SearchIndexing-Backingupandrecoveringyourindex]
* Fix the corrupted indexes manually, see KB article: [Lucene index corruption|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Lucene+index+corruption]
* For JIRA 7.2.10, or later (on the 7.2 line, see JRASERVER-65655) the corrupted indexes are fixed automatically. There will be some data loss in Lucene index after recovery. See KB [Lucene index corruption|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Lucene+index+corruption] for details.
fields.summary: JIRA Lucene indexes get corrupted under high load and ungraceful shutdown

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When someone is changing reporter, any user with access to JIRA can be set as reporter even if he doesn't have Browse project or Create issue permission.
Then this new reporter can't see the issue of course.

Why is it possible to set anyone as reporter?

h3. Environment
* Version 1000.35.1 Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Edit the reporter of an issue

h3. Expected Results
Only users with *Browse Project* & *Create Issue* will be listed and can be selected
h3. Actual Results
Users without *Browse Project*, *Create Issue* or *Restricted Portal* customers are listed and can be selected as reporter

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: User can be set as reporter regardless Browse or Create issue permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The subtasks imported won't inherit the Security Level from the parent already created in the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a CSV with subtasks;
# Import in the project with the respective parents already using the security scheme;

h3. Expected Results
Subtasks inherit the Security from the parents.

h3. Actual Results
The subtaks are created without Security Level.

h3.Workaround
Bulk edit the parents to remove the security level and bulk edit it again to set the security level.
fields.summary: Subtasks imported via CSV won't inherit security level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61063].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
On JIRA versions prior to 7, users are able to select multiple groups using the "ctrl' key and add the user on the selected groups, however on JIRA 7, JIRA administrators need type the name of the group, and search for it and then select it at a single time. 
It means that It will be necessary type each single group name when trying to add multiple memberships to a single user. This is a road blocker when there are a huge number of groups to be added.

h5. Suggestion
Allow existing groups to be selected on a similar way of JIRA 6.x versions. See attached screenshots for reference.
fields.summary: Allow to bulk add an user in multiple JIRA groups at once

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
The formatting for text that begins or ends with white space does not work but instead simply displays the formatting characters. 
For Example: + JIRA +. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the users with the ability to enable or disable white space editing in the wiki markup between the words or notations. This allows the wiki format to still work even though there still is white space as it is being eliminated.
fields.summary: Wiki editor formatting does not work with white spaces

Currently, when you restart JIRA, the ID sequence of audit log will jump to additional 100 number.

# Perform some action in JIRA

ID sequence for audit log should continue from {{10001}}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61060].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Running the JIRA Linux .bin installer the first time creates the "jira" user.

Subsequent installs using the .bin installer then creates the user again with an integer increment appended to the end of the user name. Ie: installing again will create jira1, jira2, jira3, etc... users.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a prompt during the installation process asking the admin if the user should be created or not.
 
h3. Workaround 

Perform the steps described on [Change the User that Executes JIRA in Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Change+the+User+that+Executes+JIRA+in+Linux] and remove the user created by the JIRA installation process by using *userdel -r USER*
fields.summary: Allow admins to choose if a new user should be created or not when using the JIRA Linux .bin installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61059].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, any configuration done by an admin on project permission side can still be changed by a project admin. This deemed useless as certain permission need to be given to the project admin themselves

h3. Suggested Solution
Even though by default, a *project-level* administrator is configured to have delete ticket permission and other related project permission, if a system level admin have revoked him from these permission, he won't be allowed to re-add this permission again on his own
fields.summary: As a system admin, i do not want my configuration to be changed by a project admin

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The number of nodes plays a role on the total time taken to complete a Project Import in JIRA Data Center (JDC). This is due the additional actions it need to perform in the background by communicating with all the available nodes and replicating those information across them.

This result project import to take a longer time when the same set of data is used:
* 12 nodes took *~9 hours* in total
* 1 node took ~30 minutes in total

h3. Additional data
The Project import process has 3 stages and not until the last stage where it will make changes to the database. The first 2 stages are processing the XML and mapping the field values, where in comparison took the most time and has the biggest differences. As an example:

|| ||6 nodes||2 nodes||
|Processing XML|55 minutes|5 minutes|
|Mapping field values|55 minutes|5 minutes|

In the background, the process parses XML backup <- caches the progress <- replicates the progress via copy across the cluster <- lists nodes to notify.

The following thread can be seen long running taken during parsing the XML
{noformat}
"JiraTaskExectionThread-1" #1141 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f9bd9500800 nid=0x6a0f runnable [0x00007f9a72664000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	(...)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.listRemoteCachePeers(JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider.java:93)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.listRemoteCachePeers(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:335)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.replicatePutNotification(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:145)
	(...)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedSaxHandler.endElement(ChainedSaxHandler.java:151)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.security.xml.RestrictedXMLReader.parse(RestrictedXMLReader.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.xml.DefaultBackupXmlParser.parseBackupXml(DefaultBackupXmlParser.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportManager.getBackupOverview(DefaultProjectImportManager.java:202)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportService.getBackupOverview(DefaultProjectImportService.java:186)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.importer.project.ProjectImportSelectBackup$BackupOverviewCallable.call(ProjectImportSelectBackup.java:245)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61057].
  {panel}

Hi everyone, 

I would like to propose implementing a new API resource for retrieving version release notes information.

Basically, all the data which is available on "https://jira.XXXX.com/jira/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=XXXX&version=XXXX" page should be available in this resource (see attachment)

The main idea behind is to allow 3rd party services to fetch this info on a per-version basis for a particular project.
fields.summary: Implement "release" REST API resource in order to request release information

fields.description:
In the project summary or project issue list, hovering the "project shortcuts" icon shows the list of project shortcuts.

When moving the mouse to that pop-up list, the pop up vanishes.

This happens with Jira 7.1.2#71006-sha1:8e7e309 and Chromium 49.0.2623.108 and Firefox 46.0 on Ubuntu 14.04
fields.summary: Project shortcuts in collapsed sidebar are not accessible

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Version history|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.extra.jira-ical-feed/versions#b100400130] for iCalendar plugin seems to be not accurate.

The latest version has been uploaded but not listed compatible with JIRA version 7.1.x.
It seems that the bundled version is 1.4.5 (not even listed on Marketplace).

h3. Suggested Solution

The version history list for iCalendar plugin need to be updated. According to compatibility with JIRA

This is tracked here: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JICAL-37

...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61053].
  {panel}

Could you please make sure [documentation about the difference between 'JIRA System Administrators' and 'JIRA Administrators' global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?

# According to [Configuring issue cloning|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-issue-cloning-802593136.html], this feature is only for *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
#- However, if we limit the discussion to *the cloned issue summary field prefix* feature, it can be configured by *JIRA Administrators*
# [Instrumentation|https://ja.confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/viewing-jira-application-instrumentation-statistics-802593019.html] page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
# [Atlassian Support Tools|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/navigating-to-the-atlassian-tools-support-page-720417607.html] page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
# [Project Import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-issues-from-jira-server-applications-802592923.html] page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?
#- FYI. In [the doc about Project Import page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/importing-issues-from-jira-server-applications-802592923.html], it uses a word *JIRA Import* but should use the word *Project Import* accurately
# [The list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27] said,
bq. Configure attachments (but they can set the size limits of attachments and enable thumbnails).
but *JIRA Administrators* also be able to configure *Enable ZIP support* in [Attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-file-attachments-802593126.html] page
# *Plugin Data Storage* page is only visible to *JIRA System Administrators*
#- Should this feature be added to [the list in the doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/managing-global-permissions-802592439.html#Managingglobalpermissions-sysadminAbout%27JIRASystemAdministrators%27and%27JIRAAdministrators%27]?

Additionally, our customer must be happier if the documents about each feature also mention clearly which global permission is required to do them.

Regards,
fields.summary: Documentation about the difference between 'JIRA System Administrators' and 'JIRA Administrators' global permission

fields.description:
When using the JIRA REST API to get issue creation metadata we hit (GET) the following route:
/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields

See https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/issue-getCreateIssueMeta for documentation about that route.

We expect to get the issue creation data with issue types and fields expanded, however we get an error response:


{code:xml}
<status>
<status-code>500</status-code>
<stack-trace>java.lang.NullPointerException</stack-trace>
</status>
{code}


The stack trace isn’t really helpful. What could be wrong or how could we investigate further?

JIRA Server Build 6336
Version 6.3.6

--- Edit ---
We found the following log:
{code:java}
/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null

              ... 1 filtered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61048].
  {panel}

I understand that JRA-38795 has rejected automatically updating filters when a custom field is renamed.

However if the query is stored as a string it would be possible to search these strings for any that contain the name of the custom field. 

This data could then be displayed to the administrator on the 'confirmation screen'.

Displaying the ID/name of the filters and the name of the owner would give the administrator a chance to pro-actively notify the owners of the filters that they will need to update their filters.
fields.summary: As a jira admin asked to rename a custom field, I want to know which filters contain the custom field, so I know which ones to update
